title: 820-3787-A shutting down
message:
Received a Late 2013 Retina Macbook Pro 15 inch today. It's randomly shutting down which I have replicated. I've read around and i'm seeing U7310 listed as a common failure point on these boards. The only issue i've got then (assuming correct diagnosis) is that I cannot find the recommended replacement of FDMF6708N in stock anywhere at any reputable suppliers. I can get FDM6823A and FDM6820A from a reputable supplier but am unsure if these are compatible replacements as there seems to be some minor differences. - Pin 1 of FDM6708N is ZCD_EN but on FDM6823A and FDM6820A Pin 1 is SMOD.

Any thoughts on possible replacments or sources of FDMF6708N?

title: 820-3787-A shutting down
message: FDMF3030 could be a suitable replacement but I don't think anyone tried it yet.

title: 820-3787-A shutting down
message: Certainly looks like it from the datasheet - I shall order a few and try them!

title: 820-3787-A shutting down
message:
Just to report back on this for future reference - FDMF3030 works fine as replacement for the original FDMF6708N recommendation.

Got mine from mouser!

title: 820-3787-A shutting down
message:
Thanks for feedback.
This will help other members, as FDMF6708N seems to be out of stock.

BTW, original Apple chip, is FDMF6808N...

title: 820-3787-A shutting down
message: [B][USER=1547]CRC2018[/USER], did this solve your issue with your Board?[/B]

title: 820-3787-A shutting down
message:
Hi Thomas

yes just replaced U7310 with FDMF3030 fixed the issue - i've cinebenched it several times since replacement and no more shut down.
